polimi.reds.broker.routing
Interface Router

All Superinterfaces:
PacketListener
All Known Implementing Classes:
GenericRouter
public interface Router
extends PacketListener

This interface is the "core" of a REDS broker. Classes that implement this interface constitutes the main component of a REDS broker. It is registered to the Overlay to receive messages coming from the other nodes of the network. In most cases it delegates its main functionalities to the other components that compose a REDS broker: namely, the RoutingStrategy and the ReplyManager. It holds the common data structure managed by those components: the SubscriptionTable and the ReplyTable.

MESSAGE_CLASS

static final java.lang.String MESSAGE_CLASS
Recommended traffic class for PUBLISH and REPLY messages.
The actual association between a subject and a traffic class must be performed by the router implementation in use. The router can also choose to use classes different from the recommended ones, or leave all messages in the default class.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

FILTER_CLASS

static final java.lang.String FILTER_CLASS
Recommended traffic class for SUBSCRIBE, UNSUBSCRIBE and UNSUBSCRIBEALL messages.
The actual association between a subject and a traffic class must be performed by the router implementation in use. The router can also choose to use classes different from the recommended ones, or leave all messages in the default class. However, the SUBSCRIBE, UNSUBSCRIBE and UNSUBSCRIBEALL subjects MUST belong to the same traffic class; putting them in separate classes may lead to incorrect subscription tables.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

subscribe

void subscribe(NodeDescriptor neighborID,
               Filter filter)
Subscribes the specified neighbor to the messages matching the given Filter.

Note that reconfigurators assume that the implementation of this method is synchronized on the router object, so that the reconfigurator can acquire the lock when it needs to make sure that no router operations are executed concurrently with reconfiguration actions.

Parameters:
neighborID - the identifier of the neighbor which subscribed.
filter - the Filter used to determine the messages the neighbor is interested in.

unsubscribe

void unsubscribe(NodeDescriptor neighborID,
                 Filter filter)
Unsubscribes the specified neighbor from the messages matching the given Filter. In general, it undoes a corresponding call to the subscribe method.

Note that reconfigurators assume that the implementation of this method is synchronized on the router object, so that the reconfigurator can acquire the lock when it needs to make sure that no router operations are executed concurrently with reconfiguration actions.

Parameters:
neighborID - the identifier of the neighbor which wants to be unsubscribed.
filter - the Filter used to determine the messages the neighbor is no more interested in.

unsubscribeAll

void unsubscribeAll(NodeDescriptor neighborID)
Removes all the subscriptions previously issued by the give neighbor.

Note that reconfigurators assume that the implementation of this method is synchronized on the router object, so that the reconfigurator can acquire the lock when it needs to make sure that no router operations are executed concurrently with reconfiguration actions.

Parameters:
neighborID - the identifier of the neighbor which requested to be unsubscribed.

publish

void publish(NodeDescriptor neighborID,
             Message message)
Publish the given message coming from the specified neighbor. Depending on the routing policy adopted, this requires to forward the given message to some or any of the neighbors of the broker this router is part of.
If message is instance ofRepliable, the Router needs to activate the ReplyManager to record the message in the ReplyTable.

Note that reconfigurators assume that the implementation of this method is synchronized on the router object, so that the reconfigurator can acquire the lock when it needs to make sure that no router operations are executed concurrently with reconfiguration actions.

Parameters:
neighborID - the identifier of the neighbor from which the message was received.
message - the Message to be published.

getID

NodeDescriptor getID()
Returns the unique identifier of this broker within the REDS network.

Returns:
the unique identifier of this broker within the REDS network.

SubscriptionTable getSubscriptionTable()

the overlay

forwardReply

void forwardReply(Reply reply)
Forwards the given reply to to its sender. According to the informations contained into the local reply table the reply will be sent to a specific neighbor or dropped if no information about its sender is contained in the reply table.

Note that reconfigurators assume that the implementation of this method is synchronized on the router object, so that the reconfigurator can acquire the lock when it needs to make sure that no router operations are executed concurrently with reconfiguration actions.

Parameters:
reply - the reply to be sent.
